titlestmt.titleproper: Robert E. Connor genealogical research materials 1872-1994 1983-1994
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Robert E. Connor genealogical research materials
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Robert E. Connor lived in Philadelphia. He was affiliated with the Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes genealogical and historical research on several topics. Genealogical research on the Connor and allied familes includes: correspondence regarding the research; photocopies of primary sources such as death registers, birth certificates, and parish records (many from England and Ireland); photocopies from published sources; datasheets; and family charts and pedigrees. There are also some handouts and photocopies about doing genealogical research, particularly Irish genealogical research. The collection also includes family charts and datasheets related to the genealogy of Benjamin Franklin, listing many members of the Bache and Duane families. There are also photocopies of articles and some printed materials on the history of the John B. Stetson hat company.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
